intro: Sanicula lamelligera var. wakayamensis, commonly known as the Wakayama sanicula, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, delicate appearance. The small white flowers bloom in late spring, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
